intro: Muellera nudiflorens, commonly known as the naked-flowered muellera, is a flowering plant native to the wet tropical forests of northern South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its smooth, glabrous stems and leaves that are typically elliptical or ovate in shape. Its flowers are small, clustered in umbels, and often have a distinctive white or pale coloration. Muellera nudiflorens is adapted to humid, shaded environments and plays a role in the ecological dynamics of its native habitat.
